newsitem.title: MEXICO: RESEARCH ALERT - Kimberly Clark lowered.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Kimberly Clark lowered.

text.p: ING Barings downgraded its rating on Kimberly Clark de Mexico to hold from buy, the brokerage said in a statement Friday.
-- Analyst Ana Maria Mendez said the company has "healthy growth prospects," but is trading at almost 21 times 1997 adjusted earnings in dollar terms.
-- "The stock should yield an annualised return in 1997 and 1998 of 13.3 percent and 12.9 percent respectively," she wrote.

-- Mendez also foresaw a 62 percent increase in reported net income in 1997 due to an extraordinary gain and a 39 percent fall in 1998, a 2.6 increase in net sales in 1997 and a 12.2 percent increase in 1998. Gross margins should improve, she added, to 41 percent in 1997 and 41.8 percent in 1998, from 39 percent in 1996.
-- She said the company's merger with Crisoba has not yet benefited Kimberly Clark at an operating level but has improved efficiency and injected some cash from asset divestitures.
-- Kimberly Clark de Mexico stock closed Thursday at 170.80 pesos per share.
